turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Mr. Kross, I'm not here to sell you my stock.  On the contrary, I'm here to buy yours.

turns.speaker: KROSS
turns.text: You've got a lot of nerve.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: No.  What I have is a lot of money.

turns.speaker: KROSS
turns.text: I know all about you, Mr. Harris. When you buy companies, they have a way of disappearing.  Even the pension funds are stripped clean. The last three companies you took over were cut up in so many pieces, widows were left without their retirement checks.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: What I did with those companies was perfectly legal.

turns.speaker: KROSS
turns.text: I don't question the legality of what you do.  It's your morality that makes me sick.  I will not allow my company to be raped by a man like you.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: It is <u>not</u> your company.  It's a public company.  And I <u>am</u> going to acquire it.  Either I buy from the other stock holders, or I buy from you.

turns.speaker: KROSS
turns.text: Mr. Harris.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: How are you, Mr. Kross.

turns.speaker: KROSS
turns.text: Not bad for a man who hasn't slept in four nights.  I'll get used to it.

turns.speaker: KROSS
turns.text: Yes.  I'm here to tell you that I've reconsidered my position on your acquisition offer.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: <u>Expected</u>... offer.

turns.speaker: KROSS
turns.text: Of course, yes.  After the <u>expected</u> filing period is over, I'm going to recommend to the board that we accept your bid.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You're making the right decision, sir.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Stop.  For just a moment.  Mr. Kross, I'd like to ask you a few questions <u>before</u> you sign. You realize that you're a target. If you weren't mine, you'd be someone elses, correct?

turns.speaker: KROSS
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: If you had a... reprieve, what would do?

turns.speaker: KROSS
turns.text: I... I would take advantage of it.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: KROSS
turns.text: I... I don't know.  There... there wasn't time...

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I suppose you'd find out soon enough that you have assets you presently don't seem aware of, wouldn't you?  The waste processing licenses at that abandoned shipyard of yours, you'd certainly find out about that.

turns.speaker: KROSS
turns.text: Quiet.  Would I get the loans?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: This time I imagine you would, yes.  Hmm...  With all this in mind, Mr. Kross, I can't logically make a formal bid on your company, can I?

turns.speaker: KROSS
turns.text: You'd be initiating a financial battle you'd ultimately lose, Mr. Harris.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You're very right.  I think the best thing we could all do is go home.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Hey Sugar, you lookin' for a date?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You looking' for some company?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Uh, no.  How do I get to Beverly Hills?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: What?  You gonna tell me you're lost?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Great.  What do I look like a tourguide?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: No, you look like a hooker.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Actually, I'm a movie star out for a walk.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Good.  Can you tell me how to get to Beverly Hills?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Sure.  For five bucks.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: That's ridiculous.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: The price just went up to ten.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Why don't you just do it out of the kindness of your heart?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Sit... and spin.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Sit-and-spin.  Alright... why not?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Nice car.  Yours?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Stolen?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Not exactly.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Mind if I turn on some heat?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: If you can figure it out, be my guest.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Very good.  You're obviously mechanical.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You're not from L.A., huh?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: New York.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: What motel you staying at?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: <u>Ho</u>tel.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Okay, what <u>ho</u>tel?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Regent Beverly Wilshire.  I bet you know it.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Yeah, I peed in the fountain there once.  Give me a break.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: What do you want it to be?  Vivian, my name's Vivian.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You like being a hooker, Vivian?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: It pays.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: So do day jobs.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Day jobs, yeah.  I've tried them.  Turn right.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Must be dangerous.  Hooking.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Tell me about it.  L.A. is suffering from a wacko epidemic. And who knows where half the guys I pick up have been.  I mean, I use condoms.  Always.  And I get checked out once a month at the free clinic.  Not only am I better in the sack than an amateur, I'm probably safer.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Very good.  You ought to have that printed up on your business card.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: If you're making fun of me, I don't like it.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Sorry.  If I did, I didn't mean to.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Ugly habit, biting your nails.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You don't know habits, you think this is ugly.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: What do you charge for company, Vivian?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Company would cost you... a hundred dollars.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: For the whole night?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: For an hour.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You're joking.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I never joke about money.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Neither do I.  A hundred bucks an hour though. That's pretty stiff.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: No, but it's getting there.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Vivian, how much to put up with me for the entire night?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You couldn't afford it.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Three hundred.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: What's your name, lover.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Edward.  My name is Edward.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Edward... you got it!

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Get in.  This side.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You know how to drive a stick?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Better believe it.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Then let's go.  It's worth 300 just so I don't have to drive.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: My raincoat's in the back.  Put it on.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You may feel more comfortable. This is not the kind of place that rents rooms by the hour.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You mean they don't have hookers.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Every place has hookers, but if this hotel has hookers, they don't look like they're...

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Off the boulevard.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Room service.  What do you drink?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Diet coke.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Send up a bottle of Crystal champagne.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Can I have some chips?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: -- and a bowl of strawberries. Thank you.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Want to know something?  I don't quite know.  I hadn't planned this.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Do you plan everything?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Always.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Well, the meter's running, it's your money.  Speaking of which, cash'll do.  In advance.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Fair enough.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Let's talk some more first.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Right.  So!  In town on business?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Let me guess, you're a... lawyer.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: And why do you say that?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I dunno... you have that sharp, useless look.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Sounds like you've known a lot of lawyers.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I've known a lot of everybody.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I think he wanted you to tip him.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Tsk.  Excuse me, I didn't think he had change for a hundred.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Where are they?  Shopping together?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: They should be.  They're both good at it.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: It's a very good year.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Oooh, thank god.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Try a strawberry.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Because they bring out the flavor of the champagne.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Jesus, you act like you're seducing some Valley girl you picked up in a dance club.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Vivian... the meter's running... cooperate.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You really are a very beautiful girl.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Just a romantic, that's you.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: What do you like?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: If I want you to turn me on I'll pay <u>you</u> three hundred.  Just lay back and let me drive.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Good morning.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You didn't wake me.  I'll be out of here in a minute.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: No hurry.  Would you like some breakfast?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Did you sleep well?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Yeah.  Too good.  I forgot where I was.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Occupational hazard?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Where'd you go?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I took the couch.  I had some work to do.  About last night...

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Oooh, Baby, you were the best. I was beside myself.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Mmm, I could tell.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I just hope it was worth three hundred bucks.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I'd say you give a good dollar value.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Do you ever... enjoy it?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I like guys if that's what you're asking.  Not that I trust'm.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: No?  Why's that?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: "Occupational hazard".

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I buy companies.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: No shit.  They expensive?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: The one I'm buying this week will cost around 150 million.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: ... dollars?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: So what a ya do with the companies once you buy'm?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I sell them.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: What?  Why?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: By breaking up a company's assets --

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: What are assets?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Vivian --

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: C'mon, I might buy a company some day.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Assets are anything of value a company owns.  Sometimes the pieces are worth more than the whole.  By selling them off, I make a profit.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Sorta like stealing cars and selling'm for parts, huh?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Not... quite.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: There, see?  Now the emblem is right in the middle of the knot.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Where'd you learn to do this?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I fucked the debate team in high school.  Tsk.  I had a grampa. He liked ties on Sundays.  You mind if I take a swim in your bathtub before I hit it?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Don't drown.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: All right.  How much for the week?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I'm in town until Saturday.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: It'd cost you.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Of course.  How much?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Five full nights... days too?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Four thousand.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Vivian, may I point out five more nights at three hundred a night is only 1,500.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: But you want days too.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: All right, two thousand.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Three.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Done.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Holy shit.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I'm not just talking about sex.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Look butthead, I'll treat you so nice you'll never want to let me go, okay?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Three thousand for five days. And Vivian, I will let you go.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Never answer the phone.  Ever.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Tsk, believe me, this will be the last time.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Did you buy some clothes?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I got a dress, yeah.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Just one?  Christ... I hope it's appropriate.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: It's very tasteful.  I think you'll especially like the zipper in the crotch.  I'm -- joking.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Let's hope so.  You'll get some more clothes tomorrow.  I'll be pushed for time so meet me in the hotel lobby at seven forty-five sharp.  Got it?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: No, I don't "got it".  Even the farmboys back in Georgia come to the door when they're taking you on a date.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: This isn't a date.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Go by yourself then.  Where you taking me anyway?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: The Rex.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Any good?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I think you'll approve.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: ... all right.  I'll meet you in the lobby.  But only cause you're paying me to.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Thank you <u>very much</u>.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I thought I told you not to answer the phone.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Oooh!

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You're forgiven.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: And that's the way the game is played.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Some game.  Screwin' some poor slob out of his retirement.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You're upset, huh?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Upset.  No.  I never get upset about business.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You liked the guy, though.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Whether I liked him or not is irrelevant.  It's business. There's no emotion involved in business... if you want to survive.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: We're the exactly the same!  Kit keeps telling me don't get emotional when you turn tricks -- that's why no kissing -- it's too personal. The key is like you're saying, stay numb, don't get involved -- when I'm with a guy, I'm a robot, I just do it.  Except with you.  At your price I give my all...

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Know what we're gonna do in a little while then?  We're gonna call Domino's and have'm deliver a bigass pizza.  We're gonna eat it in bed.  We're gonna veg' out and watch television.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Television?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Yeah, it's this box, it has pictures, sound.  You don't have to use your brain at all.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I have work to do.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Uh-uh.  No work.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I still don't understand why you only bought one dress.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I wasn't as much fun as I thought it was going to be.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Well, you know those cold bitches that work in those stores and try to intimidate you?  It works.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Was someone rude to you?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I had a little problem in one store.  I wasn't dressed right. I don't know what to say.  I don't belong there.  Maybe I'll just go back to Bridget.  She was cool.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Vivian, you belong wherever you are.  I don't care how you were dressed, they were the ones who were wrong, not you.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Come with me?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I thought maybe you'd like dinner.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Thank you.  I would.  Nice.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Wait till you see what I have on underneath.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: What about dinner?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Dinner can wait.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You always been rich?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Seems like it.  I guess it's easy to get used to, huh?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Easier than learning how to be poor.  My father's family was wealthy. When I was young there were cars and houses, private schools, nannies.  But then my father divorced my mother to marry another woman.  And he took his money with him.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Keep talkin'.  I like hearin'.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Not much to tell.  I went to public school.  Went to university on scholarship.  Went to work for an investment firm. In eight years I owned it.  My father was chairman of the board of the third company I ever went after.  I swallowed that company and shit out the pieces. One of the pieces was him.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You still mad at'm?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: He died a long time ago.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You're really pushing it, bringing me here.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I think it's exciting.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: What id we run into someone I know?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I really doubt anyone here frequents Hollywood Boulevard.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You did.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Real genuine guy.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: He's good at what he does.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You could freeze ice on his wife's ass.  She anything like your ex?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Shall we mingle?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Edward, these women here, I don't think any of'm like the guys they're with.  They're just into it for the money.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I'm sure that's true for some of them.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I thought I was the pro.  These women make me feel like an amateur.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Ready to stomp sod?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You asshole!  I can't believe what a --!

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Vivian, what the --

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Clean the slut up, take her out, huh?!  What are you trying to prove!?  I'm not a piece of meat for you to offer to your friends!

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I've been with stinking old men who've made me want to puke but I've never had anyone make me feel as dirty as you did tonight.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Would you please calm down.  Tell me what happened.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Stuckey!  He wants an "appointment" with me after you leave.  You my pimp now or did he think that up on his own?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: What was I supposed to do?  I told the truth.  Why should the truth upset you?  It's not as if you're from a convent.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I want my fucking money.  I'm getting out of here.  I don't want anything more to do with you.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Can we talk about this?  Can you just try to calm down?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Your goddamned friend, he thinks the only reason I'm with you is for the money.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Well, it's true.  Just pay me what you owe me and I'm gone.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Vivian...

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Pay me!  Before I pick up this chair and smash your face in.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Fine.  I'm only here a couple of more days and I'm not going to spend them fighting with you.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Fuck off.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I'll call you a cab.  If you want the clothes, pack them up.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Vivian... I'm sorry.  I wasn't prepared for questions about us. It was an idiotic and insensitive thing I did.  I should have known that it would hurt you.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I'm not hurt.  It doesn't hurt you when somebody pisses on you, it just pissed you off.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I really am sorry.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Do I look okay?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Hmm... let's see... no, there's something missing.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I don't want you to get too excited... these are on loan... however...

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Edward, I can't.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Shush.  Of course you can.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: What if I lose it?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You won't.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: What if someone tries to steal it?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I'll guard them and you with my life.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You don't want to go all the way to San Francisco in a limousine, do you?  I don't.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Where are you taking me!?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: To meet some friends.  Rudolpho, a poet... Benoit, a landlord... Mimi, a flower maker...

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: The opera.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I've never been on a plane before.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I'm glad you like it.  Now be quiet, I've really got to read these.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Sorry.  You're not paying me to ask you question like that.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Vivian.  I'm paying you to be you.  Be you.  Have you?  Ever been in love with anyone?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You mean, besides Elvis?  I'm a human being.  Sure.  Once. First time I ever ran away from home, I got as far as Atlanta. I met this boy.  He'd been with his parents on their way to Chicago.  They stopped at a gas station.  He went to the john. When he came back they'd split. We sorta started looking out for each other.  Aw, he was sweet. And boy, was he good looking, y'know, dark hair and eyes. The chicken hawks were on him all the time.  He hated that. Sometimes we'd find a safe place to crash nights and we'd curl up together and we'd talk about all these crazy things.  The two of us getting married someday. Having kids.  Stupid stuff.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: What happened to him?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: If it's in Italian, how will I know what they're saying?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I'll whisper some of the main parts of the story to you.  But you'll be surprised how much you understand.  The music conveys the story more powerfully than any words.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: But don't they have it in English?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Vivian, don't be afraid of what you don't know.  That's the fun of it.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: If you'd gone on about how much you liked it, I'm not sure I'd have believed you.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I more than liked it.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I know.  I'm glad.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Did you?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Yes.  I've never enjoyed it more. Thank you.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: One more night and you're finally rid of me.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Yeah, you've been pretty tough to take.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I have to go to New York tomorrow.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: What else?  You gonna leave some cash by the bed when you pass through town?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: It wouldn't be like that.  I want to get you off the street.  You'll have a different kind of life. What's wrong with that?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I'm sorry.  That's very sweet, Edward, and I know you mean it...

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Vivian, I've thought about this a lot.  This is the best solution.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: When I was a little girl, my mother locked me in the attic when I was bad, which was pretty often. I'd stare out the window up there and make believe I was a princess trapped in the tower by the wicked queen.  Then suddenly a knight on a white horse with his bright colors flying would ride up. Rescue me from the tower, and then we'd ride off... but never, ever in all the times I had that dream did the knight say, "Come on baby, I'll put you up in a great condo."

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Vivian, life's not a fairy tale.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I know.  Hey, don't mind me.  I'm being stupid.  I'll think about it, okay?  It's a real good offer for a whore.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I've never treated you like a whore.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You just did.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: What did you do to him?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Last time I saw him he was this strong guy.  Now he's beaten. And you <u>liked him</u>.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Vivian, I want you to listen to me.  The man realized that it would be better for his future and his son's future, if he cooperated.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: It's not your concern.  It's... business, that's all.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Business.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Yes.  The man made a business decision.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: It's all just business to you. Him.  Me.  Your life. Everything's business.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: It's what I do for a living. It's how I make money.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Why do guys always know how to hit a woman?  Right across the cheek, wham, so it feels like your eye is gonna explode.  What do they do, take you all aside in high school and show you how? It pisses me off!

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Not all men hit.  And no one is going to hit you anymore.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Right.  You're quite the Sir Galahad today, aren't ya'?  I heard what you did with Kross.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: It was a business decision.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I got tired of hating my father.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: It was good.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: It felt good.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You're packing.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I'm leaving.  Don't ya see?  If I stay with you like you want me to, there'll always be some guy, your friends eve, treatin' me like that... thinkin' they're allowed to.  What are you gonna do, fight'm all? No.  I'll take my money now, please.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Aw, don't... no...

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Stay with me tonight.  Not because you're being paid to. Stay with me because you want to.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I do.  I do want to.  That's why I'm leaving.  That's what you given me, see? I know what I want now.  I want a guy like you for real.  Not because you buy me things and give me money.  The nicest thing you ever done for me is hold my hand. You gonna give me that?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I didn't think so.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Vivian...

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: It's not your fault.  You're right.  Kit's right.  But I want the fairy tale.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: Barnard Thomas, manager of the hotel.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Of course, yes.  If you'll excuse me just a moment --

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: I have a message for you from your "niece", sir.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: My what?

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: The young lady staying in your room?

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: Mr. Harris, a guest of yours, is a guest of ours and shall be treated accordingly.  The young lady asked me to tell you that she is waiting for you in the lounge.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: Good afternoon, Mr. Harris.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Afternoon.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: What's up, where you going?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Give me your car keys, will you, I'm going back to my hotel.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: At least stay for a drink.  This party's for you.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Apologize to Elizabeth for me.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Listen, there're some major local talent inside just dying to meet you...

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Really?  Some high class gold digger who speaks French better than I do?  No, thank you.  I just got off the phone with one.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Cynthia's not coming?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Love this car!  Is it new?

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Yes!  And you don't even know where you're going!

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I want to.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Edward, if the three of us sit down together we might as well announce our plans in the Wall Street Journal.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I'll see him alone.  Everyone knows you're my muscle.  We'll make it social.  Tell Kross I'll meet him for dinner.  Tonight if you can arrange it.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: You shouldn't go alone.  He might claim that you tried to black mail him.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Bill, we're businessmen, not the damn mafia.  I'll see you in the office.  By the way, about your car...

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Oh, god, what?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I'll bring it back.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Edward, did you hear me?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I'm here.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: I know a lot of nice girls.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: What!?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: We don't have the time to bring someone new up to speed. Besides...  You've already impressed everyone you need to, haven't you?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: What time's diner tonight?

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Eight o'clock.  Kross is bringing his son.  Very bright kid, watch yourself with him.  Who's this girl you're taking?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: No one you know.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Goddamit!  Where is he getting the money to fight?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Someone's loaning it to him. Get on it right away.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Our contract guys are working on the Kross pension funds. There's another forty million there.  We can bleed'm dry.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Put the pension funds on hold until I say otherwise.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: We're letting them slide?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I want the treatment plant licenses to be top priority right now.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: But, Edward...

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Do it.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Excuse me for saying this but what is wrong with you this week? First, you go soft on the pension funds.  Now, you're giving him the chance to get away?  As of two minutes ago, you are committed to the tune of over fifty million dollars --

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Come on, Bill, don't talk to me about how much money's involved. It's my money.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: And some of it's mine.  Edward, his jugular's exposed.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Bill, I'd like you to meet Vivian.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Bill Stuckey, Vivian.  My wife, Elizabeth.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Fill me in on this.  How'd you and Vivian meet?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: We just did.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Come on, you can tell me.  I sure would like to know where a guy runs into a girl as attractive as this.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: The night I left your house, I was lost.  I was looking for directions.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: And you just happened to run into her.  Great.  What's she do?  She work?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Doing what?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Vivian's in sales.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Sales, really?  That's great. What does she sell?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Why do you want to know?

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Hear me out.  I've known you a long time.  I see a difference in you this week.  Like that tie. I'm suddenly wondering if this girl's not the difference. Especially when I see her talking with David Kross.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: She met him at dinner last night... I like this tie.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: So now they're best friends? Edward, this girl appears out of nowhere and now I see her talking to a guy whose company we're trying to buy.  It's too convenient.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You're being ridiculous.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Industrial espionage is not ridiculous.  Edward, how do you know she hasn't attached herself to you so she can bring Kross back information?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Christ, Bill, she's not a spy, she's a hooker.  I picked her up off Hollywood Boulevard.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: This is no time to disappear. We're in too far.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Bill?  Stop panicking.  Kross isn't going anywhere and I don't need to spend the rest of the day watching his stock go down.  I'll be in the office tomorrow.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Promise me you'll read those contracts by then.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Goodbye, Bill.
